Description: Rest on the Flight into Egypt; nocturnal scene with Joseph standing at left, turned to right and holding a torch in his right hand; looking at the Virgin seated at right, on whose lap the nude Christ Child is lying; an angel standing next to the Virgin, looking at St Joseph; the ass at far right; after Elsheimer; the sheet torn vertically and repaired along centre left. Engraving
Producer name: Print made by: Jan van de Velde II (formerly attributed)
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (1.I) (Poel)
Acquisition notes: For the history of the acquisition of the Sheepshanks collection, please see Sheepshanks.1
